p: After 14 weeks of feeding, final weights were lowest when using the diet with the lowest fish meal and fish oil content (ω3LC0), followed by the diet containing the highest level of animal by-products. Fish fed diets ω3LC0, ω3LC1, and ω3LC1.41 had the lowest hepatosomatic index (HSI) and fish fed the marine diet had the highest HSI ( Table 4). The lowest specific growth rate (SGR) was obtained with the ω3LC0 and animal by-product diets ( Table 4). The condition factor (CF) was not influenced due to relatively similar growth in body weight and length, which shows that the diets were well designed.
